rules: Rule1: Provided that the institution is authorized for research, then drug X is approved.
Rule2: Under the condition that the grant has approved funding, drug X is approved.
Rule3: Whenever bill 123 passes legislative vote, it becomes law.
Rule4: Either bill 123 passes legislative vote or the president grants executive approval.
Rule5: Provided that the president grants executive approval, then the grant has approved funding.
Rule6: Whenever bill 123 becomes law, the FDA establishes guidelines.
Rule7: If the FDA is created as an agency, then the institution is authorized for research.
Rule8: Provided that the FDA establishes guidelines, then the FDA is created as an agency.
Rule9: If the pharma company has exclusive rights, then drug X is approved.
Rule10: Provided that the supplier engages in illegal import, then the supplier is a registered importer.
Rule11: Whenever the supplier engages in illegal import, criminal charges are filed.
Rule12: Either the supplier engages in illegal import or, if the pharma company has a patent, then it has exclusive rights.
Rule13: Under the condition that the shipment is subject to customs seizure, then the supplier is not a registered importer.
Rule14: If the FBI opens an investigation, then the shipment is subject to customs seizure.
Rule15: Provided that criminal charges are filed, then the FBI opens an investigation.
Rule16: Either the clinical trial phase is completed or the study passes peer review.
Rule17: Whenever the study passes peer review, drug X is approved.
Rule18: If an independent data audit is conducted, then, provided that the clinical trial phase is completed, drug X is approved.
Rule19: Under the condition that the statistical analysis is valid, then, if the clinical trial phase is completed, drug X is approved.
Rule20: Provided that the monitoring committee conducts a review, then an independent data audit is conducted.
Rule21: Either the monitoring committee conducts a review or adverse events are reported.
Rule22: Under the condition that a safety assessment is completed, then the statistical analysis is valid.
Rule23: Provided that a protocol amendment is required, then the trial is suspended temporarily.

Rule24: If a DSMB recommendation is issued, then, under the condition that it is not the case that if adverse events are reported then a safety assessment is completed, a protocol amendment is required.
Rule25: Either a DSMB recommendation is issued or the FDA conducts a regulatory inspection.

Rule26: Whenever the FDA conducts a regulatory inspection, then, provided that it is not the case that if adverse events are reported then a safety assessment is completed, a protocol amendment is required.
Rule27: Either the quality control check fails or it is not the case that a manufacturing complaint is received.
Rule28: Either a batch recall is initiated or it is not the case that the quality control check fails.
Rule29: Either production is halted at the facility or it is not the case that a batch recall is initiated.
Rule30: If the company makes a false claim, then it is not the case that the company violates a regulation.

Rule31: Provided that a whistleblower report is submitted, then, under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that the company makes a false claim then corrective action is taken, a warning letter is issued.

Rule32: If a hearing is scheduled, then, under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if it is not the case that if drug X is approved then clinical trials require approval then drug X has safety data then the committee does not pass review, drug X gets market approval.
Rule33: Whenever the company violates a regulation, then the company pays a fine.
Rule34: Under the condition that the company violates a regulation, then it is not the case that the company pays a fine.
Rule35: Either the company violates a regulation or either the manufacturer submits a report or, if drug X is not approved, then it is not the case that the lab completes testing.
Rule36: Under the condition that it is not the case that if adverse events are reported then a safety assessment is completed, then it is not the case that the trial is suspended temporarily.

Rule37: Provided that it is not the case that either the manufacturer submits a report or, if drug X is not approved, then it is not the case that the lab completes testing, then a manufacturing complaint is received.

Rule38: Under the condition that it is not the case that if it is not the case that if drug X is approved then clinical trials require approval then drug X has safety data, then the committee passes review.
Rule39: Whenever it is not the case that the company makes a false claim, then it is not the case that corrective action is taken.
Rule40: If drug X is not approved, then the lab completes testing.
facts: Fact1: The pharma company has a patent.
Fact2: A whistleblower report is submitted.
Fact4: It is not the case that clinical trials require approval.
Fact5: It is not the case that drug X has safety data.
Fact6: It is not the case that production is halted at the facility.
Fact7: It is not the case that drug X gets market approval.
Fact8: It is not the case that a warning letter is issued.
Fact9: It is not the case that the manufacturer submits a report.
